newsitem.title: UK: Telspec gains on recovery hopes.
newsitem.headline: Telspec gains on recovery hopes.

text.p: Shares in Telspec Plc leapt on Thursday as the telecommunications equipment group reported a heavy loss of 1996 but said it expected to return to profitability in the current year.
"The bottom line figures were if anything slightly worse than expected," said one market-maker in the stock, "but there was a reasonable statement talking about recovery which was encouraging."
The stock, which plummeted last September after the company issued a second profit warning of the year, was up 27-1/2p at 225 by 1229 GMT on volume of 247,065 shares.

Telspec said it fell to a pre-tax loss of 9.9 million stg in 1996 from a profit of 8.7 million a year before, but chairman Frank Hackett-Jones said "decisive action" had been taken and worldwide demand remained strong.
"We expect the performance improvement established in the second half (of 1996) to continue throughout 1997," Hackett-Jones said.

Listed in December 1993, Telspec shares set a record 10.50 stg in November 1995, before tumbling last May as the group warned that first-half profits would be hit by a number of temporary factors, with some high-margin sales deferred to the second half of the year.
Then last September it said the difficulties had been "significantly worse" than it had first expected and the shares hit a low of 130p at the end of 1996.
